intro: Psiadia callocephala, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with glossy, narrow leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Psiadia callocephala is also known for its ability to thrive in coastal environments with high salt exposure.
